content: quote: Originally posted by BAGodbehere: quote: Right, they have the option of standing up with their hands in their pockets for an incoming President... Exactly,, everyone bolts from their seats and goes straight to attn. No matter who the President is. quote: If there were hard feelings, they weren't on public display at the Central Intelligence Agency. Hundreds of agency employees packed the lobby of the original headquarters building to hear Obama and exploded in cheers and applause when he strode in with CIA director Leon Panetta. "Don't be discouraged by what's happened the last few weeks. Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said. "But the fact that we are willing to acknowledge them and then move forward, that is precisely why I am proud to be president of the United States and that's why you should be proud to be members of the CIA." Hmm? "exploded in cheers?" Maybe they like to hear someone say, "Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said." As opposed to, (pardon the quotes)"None of this is our fault, just some incompetents in the CIA. We didn't make ANY mistakes, they did." Dave
quote: Originally posted by BAGodbehere: quote: Right, they have the option of standing up with their hands in their pockets for an incoming President... Exactly,, everyone bolts from their seats and goes straight to attn. No matter who the President is.
reply: quote: If there were hard feelings, they weren't on public display at the Central Intelligence Agency. "Don't be discouraged by what's happened the last few weeks. Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said. "But the fact that we are willing to acknowledge them and then move forward, that is precisely why I am proud to be president of the United States and that's why you should be proud to be members of the CIA." Hmm? "exploded in cheers?" Maybe they like to hear someone say, "Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said." As opposed to, (pardon the quotes)"None of this is our fault, just some incompetents in the CIA. We didn't make ANY mistakes, they did." Dave

content: CIA is civilians? What about the Secret Service, FBI, DEA, etc. They are just as much in the Service of the USA than the US Navy. The CIA suffered under President Clinton because the cold war was over and the State department became the clearance center on security matters. Once American citizens being killed, Khobar Towers and the USS Cole suddenly Osama Ben Laden became a household word and the CIA had a new and bigger mission. We've been playing catch up ever since and Homeland secuirty is not producing the results it should. Thank the good Lord there were some grey beards in that crowd at Langley. Asst Director of the CIA was not ecstatic. After being handed your head by a politician simply to disperse critical observations of the weakness of the new leadership comes close to a prosecutional offense more than attaining information savings the lives of Americans. I wish I could have been at the formal meeting that preceded the cheerleading ceremonies.
reply: CIA is civilians? What about the Secret Service, FBI, DEA, etc. They are just as much in the Service of the USA than the US Navy. I wish I could have been at the formal meeting that preceded the cheerleading ceremonies.

content: quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: CIA is civilians? What about the Secret Service, FBI, DEA, etc. They are just as much in the Service of the USA than the US Navy. We've been playing catch up ever since and Homeland secuirty is not producing the results it should. Thank the good Lord there were some grey beards in that crowd at Langley. content: quote: Originally posted by BAGodbehere: quote: Right, they have the option of standing up with their hands in their pockets for an incoming President... Exactly,, everyone bolts from their seats and goes straight to attn. No matter who the President is. quote: If there were hard feelings, they weren't on public display at the Central Intelligence Agency. Hundreds of agency employees packed the lobby of the original headquarters building to hear Obama and exploded in cheers and applause when he strode in with CIA director Leon Panetta. "Don't be discouraged by what's happened the last few weeks. Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said. "But the fact that we are willing to acknowledge them and then move forward, that is precisely why I am proud to be president of the United States and that's why you should be proud to be members of the CIA." Hmm? "exploded in cheers?" Maybe they like to hear someone say, "Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said." As opposed to, (pardon the quotes)"None of this is our fault, just some incompetents in the CIA. We didn't make ANY mistakes, they did." Dave
quote: Originally posted by BAGodbehere: quote: Right, they have the option of standing up with their hands in their pockets for an incoming President... Exactly,, everyone bolts from their seats and goes straight to attn. No matter who the President is.

"But the fact that we are willing to acknowledge them and then move forward, that is precisely why I am proud to be president of the United States and that's why you should be proud to be members of the CIA." Hmm? "exploded in cheers?" Maybe they like to hear someone say, "Don't be discouraged that we have to acknowledge potentially we have made some mistakes -- that's how we learn," Obama said." content: CIA is civilians? What about the Secret Service, FBI, DEA, etc. They are just as much in the Service of the USA than the US Navy. The CIA suffered under President Clinton because the cold war was over and the State department became the clearance center on security matters. Once American citizens being killed, Khobar Towers and the USS Cole suddenly Osama Ben Laden became a household word and the CIA had a new and bigger mission. We've been playing catch up ever since and Homeland secuirty is not producing the results it should. Thank the good Lord there were some grey beards in that crowd at Langley. Asst Director of the CIA was not ecstatic. After being handed your head by a politician simply to disperse critical observations of the weakness of the new leadership comes close to a prosecutional offense more than attaining information savings the lives of Americans. I wish I could have been at the formal meeting that preceded the cheerleading ceremonies.
reply: CIA is civilians? What about the Secret Service, FBI, DEA, etc. They are just as much in the Service of the USA than the US Navy. Or were they , you know, the secratery pool people, the janitorial staff, public greeters, etc etc? Oh, question, hot links, MILITARY.COM ok, iS ANYTHING from Google ok too? Funny, the only CIA agent that has been recently outed was outed by the previous administration, if memory serves correct. Was that before or after the Vanity Fair piece with the pictures on the cover? She was no longer a field agent, but rather an office pogue relegated to sharpening pencils and answering the phones. Not according to the CIA which initiated the investigation...but what do they know, you know, faulty intel.
quote: Originally posted by Kegler300: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: All those secret agents there outed now shaking hands with the POTUS...and no outcry from the left....strange, isn't it? Was that before or after the Vanity Fair piece with the pictures on the cover? She was no longer a field agent, but rather an office pogue relegated to sharpening pencils and answering the phones.
